summary: Rachel (Mila Kunis) is a criminology student hoping to land a position as a teacher's assistant for professor Robert Starkman (William Shatner). She's sure this position will pave the way to an FBI career, and she's willing to do anything to obtain it -- including killing her classmates. The school psychiatrist, Dr. Daniels (Geraint Wyn Davies), becomes aware that Rachel is insane, but Rachel is skilled at her dangerous game of death and identity theft.

reviews.content: American Psycho 1 was way better, although the murders in this movie were more planned out and happened more often, it was a bit lacking.

One of the worst movies and sequels I have endured.  There is no humor, at all.  No horror, tension or even a lame jump scare.  If you are watching for Mila Kunis, not a hot outfit the entire movie and dreadful acting.  The narration by her is flat, boring and humorless.  Terrible script.  However, casting Captain Kirk (Shatner not the others) as a womanizing lecherous professor preying on his students was kind of on point.

I put off watching this movie thinking it was going to be different than it was, but I found it hilarious and very under-rated during the first 2/3rds. Supposedly it was panned by the critics when it came out, but it was very funny to me in parts, and definitely is a decent black comedy. The first 2/3rds of the movie were worth watching the whole of it. It kind of has a goofy, contrived ending which makes you shrug though. And it was probably a bad choice linking it to "American Psycho," but it is definitely worth watching...

Morgan J. Freeman is not Morgan Freeman. He directed this movie, then went on to produce Laguna Beach, 16 and Pregnant and Teen Mom.

But this movie…

I had no idea that there was a sequel to American Psycho, much less that the movie wasn't originally intended to even be a sequel. It was a script titled The Girl Who Wouldn't Die and it wasn't until production began that the film's script was altered with the incorporation of Patrick Bateman.

In fact, the author of the original book Bret Easton Ellis claims Lions Gate wanted to include a serial killer subplot in The Rules of Attraction and he turned them down, so this was the movie that resulted.

So yeah, remember that Patrick Bateman? The guy who we were left wondering is he or isn't he a serial killer? Well, this movie forgets all that nonsense by starting with him on a date with lead character Rachael Newman's (Mila Kunis) babysitter. While the 12-year-old is in the other room, Bateman kills her and dissects her. But Rachael turns the tables by stabbing him with an icepick.

Now, she's nearly all grown up and studying criminology in the class of former FBI agent Professor Starkman. That's part of her insanely obsessive path to becoming an agent herself. And he's played by William Shatner and our protagonist is in love with him, so if the idea of a 71-year-old Kirk being pursued by a 19-year-old Jackie, well then this is the movie for you.

Kunis attempted to stop production of American Psycho III, saying in an interview, "Please — somebody stop this. Write a petition. When I did the second one, I didn't know it would be American Psycho II. It was supposed to be a different project, and it was re-edited, but, ooh.."

It's astounding that this exists, that it has at least two well-known actors and that so few people are talking about it. Also, it has a cat get microwaved and despite how much I usually enjoy Kunis, I struggled through this one.
The acting itself was absolute garbage the story is extremely weak all the characters in this film are absolutly unlikeable so its impossible to care about them when they're killed off

It has an unlikable main character, an awful lot of plot holes and an ending that leaves nothing to the imagination, unlike the aforementioned "American Psycho".

But with the shoehorned addition of Patrick Bateman from the first movie, we get one of the worst sequels ever made.

American Psycho 2: All American Girl(2002)
Starring: Mila Kunis, William Shatner, Geraint Wyn Davies, Robin Dunne, Lindy Booth, Kim Poirier, Kim Schraner, Kate Keleton, Charles Officer, Kay Hawtrey, Boyd Banks, Neil Crone, and Lynne Deragon
Written By: Bret Easton Ellis
Directed By: Morgan J. Freeman
Review
ANGRIER. DEADLIER. SEXIER.
Hello Kiddies your pal the Crypt Critic here with the most boring slasher which happens to be a sequel to one of the best. That's very freaking sad!
Rachel is a criminology student hoping to land a position as a teacher's assistant for professor Robert Starkman. She's sure this position will pave the way to an FBI career, and she's willing to do anything to obtain it -- including killing her classmates. The school psychiatrist, Dr. Daniels, becomes aware that Rachel is insane, but Rachel is skilled at her dangerous game of death and identity theft.
The film feels like a tv show and a horrible one at that. Everything that went down was stupid and boring. The acting in the film is very lame from pretty much all the actors they all look very bored to be here just as we as an audience get bored from this movie.

Here's some faint praise ... this film isn't as soul-crushingly awful as you expect a sequel to "American Psycho" starring Mila Kunis and William Shatner to be.  Oh, it's terrible ... but it's nearly watchable at times.  It's clearly not a sequel to "American Psycho".  It's a stand-alone film that had a slight connection to the other film shoe-horned in.  The idea ... a girl obsessed with joining the FBI to track down serial killers becomes a serial killer to eliminate her rivals ... is not bad.  It would work better if Kunis weren't simply awful in the lead role.  As it is, you can derive some minimal entertainment from this, but there's really not a lot of reason to try.
it was pretty decent for a sequel.. i never saw mila kunis be a evil but i kinda like it.

That was actually the smell of this film on arrival. From the Morgan Freeman who is not the voice of God from Shawshank Penitentiary (and who is white) comes a lame pile of shit. American Psycho 2 is very unfaithful to its source material. In fact, this movie was not even supposed to be of American Psycho ilk.

The film stars Meg Griffin as a serial killer. I mean imagine just the annoyance of Mila Kunis's voice as she's narrating her diatribe of how she is trying to scheme her way to the top. She might as well be chewing bubble gum over the voiceover because she sounded like this role didn't matter. Hell, even Amazon trivia said Mila regretted taking this role. The way she acts doesn't signal cold, and calculating. This film's attitude does not follow in its predecessor's footsteps in any fashion whatsoever. This film is like some teenage struggle film. Where's the satire? Where's the shock? Where is any homage to Bret Easton Ellis's novel? Nowhere. This film is just another soulless cash grab.

This film honestly could have been a 2 star film, but you had to drag in Patrick Bateman. You had to smear this character's legacy by having him get killed by some idiot? You had to reference lines from the first film? You have to have the mentioning of serial killers constantly? You had to have a staircase shot? Fuck you American Psycho 2!

Terrible writing, terrible acting, and absolutely none of the balls that made American Psycho so incredible. But I was working on a new crochet project and didn't feel like channel hopping.

This movie is drivel.

Mila Kunis stars in the campy, lighthearted horror film American Psycho II: All American Girl.  Desperate to get a TA position with a prestigious college professor, criminology student Rachael Newman proceeds to kill off her competition.  Kunis gives a solid performance, and is especially good at delivering the dark comedy.  And though the plot's fairly predictable, it uses the tropes and clichés of the genre rather well.  Still, the film tries to be a little too clever at times, and the violence and gore is quite tame.  Yet despite its problems, American Psycho II: All American Girl is an entertaining slasher film.
For the love of Santa Claus don't watch this film if you loved the first! I should have known better and you should too.

God this has so little connection to the original this shouldn't even be a sequel like this is garbage only because they labeled it as a sequel to American psyco but because they threw it in the same category with one of the greatest movies ever made it becomes an unwatchable piece of shit. And really William Shatner if Mila Kunis is in love with you the only possible way you say no to her is if Jennifer Aniston or like Sofia Vergara are all over you. God.

American Psycho II tries hard to be just like the first film only featuring a women psycho.  Instead, it plays out like a mix between a teenage college flick, a comedy and a PG rated slasher film.  Miller Kunis plays a quirky and demented college student who slowly kills off classmates in order to win an assistant position.  Every kill in the film is not shown and it made me wonder how this movie got an R rating because it wasn't bloody or gruesome at all.  They attempted to throw in some comedy bits and most of them fell flat.  William Shatner was great as the professor but the rest of the cast was forgettable.  The one strong point in the film was the storyline.  There was a bit of mystery and the final segment revealed a big twist that was very entertaining.  This movie wasn't horrible like it may appear, and should satisfy someone looking for a little fun serial killer flick.
A disgrace to the original film.  Possibly the worst movie I've ever seen.

Bill Shatner at his finest! Or his worst, if you want to look at it that way. He's not the star of the film. He's the university professor who is the object of desire by Mila Kunis, who is the title American Psycho, and wants to be his TA at all costs. There's absolutely no connection to the first "American Psycho" film or book outside of a prologue that was tacked on and comes up once later in the film. The crazd pretty girl story would better have been called "Poison Ivy 3" than artificially connected to "American Psycho." Kunis has said she's embarrassed by this film and author Brett Easton Ellison has also harshly criticized the film. The only reason to watch the film is to see Shatner be a ham and play an old lech. It's neither scary or nor darkly funny.

Forget about the original.  Forget that you even saw the first American Psycho film.  American Psycho II is one of the worst films I've ever seen.  Comparing it to the original film is unnecessary because the only thing these 2 films have in common is the title.  It's so boring and predictable.  Mila Kunis' acting is so bad in this film that I gave up on her for years.  Is Kunis a young Meryl?  Hell no, but she's no Ashton Kutcher, either.  She does a decent job in Sarah Marshall and Black Swan.  Lastly, the actor Morgan Freeman almost changed his name after this movie came out.  How even one movie critic liked this movie is a mystery to me.

Direct to DVD sequel to American Psycho, American Psycho 2 is unrelated to the first; but is kind of easy to see why this film is viewed as a sequel. This one doesn't deliver, and personally I think that it was pointless to make this film as it has nothing to offer. The film has poor acting, the cast is horrible, the story is bad and the directing is sloppy. American Psycho 2 contains all the traditional elements of a straight to DVD title. The film also has miscast roles including William Shatner as the professor and Mila Kunis. I felt that nothing really clicked, and the film was simply bizarre. As far as I'm concerned, American Psycho was a perfect stand alone film that had plenty of unnerving and disturbing elements. The film is sloppy with no effort in trying to create something watchable. The film simply tried to cash in on the success of the first by using rehashed ideas, This film insults Bret Easton Ellis who wrote the book. Fans of American Psycho should pass up on this at all costs as it is a poorly crafted film with no good payoff or story for that matter. While American Psycho had great psychological horror elements that really made it a disturbing film to watch, this film lacks those elements and it just doesn't deliver. This an awful train wreck of a film that will displease fans of American Psycho. The film is one of the worst sequels that I've seen, and being straight to DVD it's no mystery why. Sequels like this should give film studio a clue not to invest money into garbage like this.
terrible plot not very good watch the first one..much better but it does have william shatner

Lacking any of the thrills from the original, this straight-to-DVD sequel is a kill-fest really only kept alive by the sexy Mila Kunis, whose sex appeal is not used to the advantage of the film. Coming off much like the sexy thrillers in Poison Ivy, but without any actual sexiness. Not even William Shatner could add anything to this film.
Unpredictable movie remains a cut above others

A film that should make you wretch just from its title, American Psycho 2 is--if you can almost completely divorce it from the original novel and film--as one critic says below "oddly amusing."  Is it intelligent, stylish, or even brutal?  No....it is total garbage.  However, Mila Kunis as Patrick Batman's much younger sister and William Shatner as her college professor manage to create a truly craptastic experience that blends comedy and slasher cliches into an enjoyably stupid mixture.
Well. It's not good, no surprises there. You knew what you would get, but it was really even worse.

This movie was bad and I mean really really bad. Bad bad bad bad bad! It doesn't even stay true to the books, the guy playing Patrick Bateman has changed and is killed not even in the first five minutes, The characters were stupid, the story was boring, The deaths weren't even brutal or at least interesting as the first film. Not even Mila Kunis who plays the female psycho is able to save the movie and look threatening which is quite sad and I don't understand how this film manged to go away with an R-rating compared to the first film. with all this bullshit in this film, this should have been rated PG-13 (USA), American Paycho: All American Girl gets a 3.5/10.

Actually when I saw Mila Kunas was the killer I was disappointed..... Boy was I wrong !!! She was a FANTASTIC follow up to Christian Bale's character and was just as scary!!!

not as good as 1st but not bad

Umm... So maybe I'm missing something, but this might be the most un-needed sequel of all time. I went into this as a huge fan of the original, and knowing that this was going to suck, but it REALLY sucks. 

Gone are any sense cerebral stimulation, original storytelling, good acting, unnerving horror scenes and interesting story of the original. Replaced with shallow characters who are intentionally turned into stereotypical teen slasher douche-bags. Mila Kunis as a brilliant student?? William Shatner as a legendary FBI agent?? Seriously? Some of the worst casting ever. 

Beyond this malarkey, the story is a dime a dozen dud with no thought or inspiration behind it. Its just a real shame to see a movie with such vision and flair turned into something so mundane, poorly crafted and trivial.
It tried to be ironic & funny, like its predecessor, but failed!

I have to agree with film critic Stefan Birgir about this one being oddly amusing...it kept me interested and it has some funny parts whereas American Psycho was just plain shocking at times. For those that remember the original one, Patrick Bateman was the American Psycho who got away killing many people, sometimes for trivial reasons like a better quality business card- seriously! The man was psycho! Anyways, this sequel finds Rachel Newman (Mila Kunis) as a 12 year old whose babysitter is on a date with Patrick Bateman. She is tied with duct tape and witnesses Bateman killing her babysitter right across from the table where she is at. Rachel manages to remove the duct tape and takes an ice pick, stabbing Bateman to death. The police nor the FBI ever discovered who killed Bateman. Fast forward to present day in America and Rachel is a freshman in college, with one goal in mind: to become Professor Starkman's (William Shatner) TA. Starkman used to be a former FBI agent who tracked down serial killers and Rachel sees Starkman as her ticket to enter the FBI Academy in Quantico VA to become an FBI agent and specialize in tracking down serial killers- how ironic right? So Rachel will eliminate anyone who stands in her way to become a TA and eventually graduate from college in criminology to attend the FBI Academy. Available in Netflix via instant streaming and yes recommended..

Umm... So maybe I'm missing something, but this might be the most un-needed sequel of all time. I went into this as a huge fan of the original, and knowing that this was going to suck, but it REALLY sucks.

Gone are any sense cerebral stimulation, original storytelling, good acting, unnerving horror scenes and interesting story of the original. Replaced with shallow characters who are intentionally turned into stereotypical teen slasher douche-bags. Mila Kunis as a brilliant student?? William Shatner as a legendary FBI agent?? Seriously? Some of the worst casting ever.

Beyond this malarkey, the story is a dime a dozen dud with no thought or inspiration behind it. Its just a real shame to see a movie with such vision and flair turned into something so mundane, poorly crafted and trivial.
I like it. Thing is don't compare it to the first one. This is a more of a guilty pleasure. A girly romp through the life of a very hot sociopath college girl. Who doesn't want to see that?

A waste of film.  Not even Mila Kunis in the lead role, who typically is very charming and watchable on film, can save the disastrous script, poor direction, and deplorable pacing of this movie.  The fact that the film has the "American Psycho" moniker is an insult, as the only scene connecting it to the original film is a obviously tacked-on moment at the start of the film.  While the original was a razor-sharp, funny, and darkly satirical look at the greed and excess of the 80's and how it corrupted a sense of decency and compassion in the average yuppie, this film is about a spoiled brat girl who decides to eliminate anyone who she feels is in the way of her criminology career.  There are long periods of dead air in the film, the death scenes are lame and childish, and Kunis' role in this tries to have the similar darkly comic tone as Christian Bale's Patrick Bateman, but Kunis doesn't hold a candle to the inspired lunacy of Bale's performance.
Cool movie about a crazy chick. Mila Kunis portraits a girl you really care about while watching the movie, even if you are a misogynist as me.
